title: [Large-scale] Information Technology-based Career Exploration Project: Strengthening Social Competencies Linked to Smart Manufacturing and Biotechnology

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy and secondary-level science/math knowledge, foundational understanding of social change (e.g., impacts of technological advancements on the workforce, civic rights, and economic systems), and awareness of digital technology applications for local community problem-solving
context.additional_context: Practice-centered education linked to regional industry demands, utilizing smartphone apps/web tools. Includes case studies on applying digital technologies to solve local community problems. Emphasizes project-based learning analyzing the impact of smart manufacturing and biotechnology advancements on regional economic structures and cultural relationships.

learning_goals: Learners design a simple data encryption project using AES-256 or RSA algorithms aligned with information security principles (confidentiality, integrity, availability). They implement it with 90%+ success across 5+ test cases, fostering digital citizenship and analyzing technology’s impact on social relations and institutions.

Within 3 weeks, learners simulate 3+ core stages of smart manufacturing processes (automated assembly lines) using AR/VR tools (e.g., Unity 3D, Unreal Engine). They submit prototypes meeting 4+ of 5 institutional evaluation criteria, analyzing Industry 4.0’s impact on industrial structures, employment, and regional economies.

Learners develop mobile spreadsheet tool skills for biotech data analysis and evaluate the socio-economic/ethical impacts of biotech advancements. They assess genetic editing’s effects on healthcare systems and patient rights from a cultural perspective.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
